dublinCore.dc:title: HR 767 ENR: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 40 Fulton Street in Middletown, New York, as the “Benjamin A. Gilman Post Office Building”.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.congress: One Hundred Seventeenth Congress of the United States of America
form.enrolled-dateline: Begun and held at the City of Washington on Monday, the third day of January, two thousand and twenty-two
form.official-title: To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 40 Fulton Street in Middletown, New York, as the Benjamin A. Gilman Post Office Building.

section.header: Benjamin A. Gilman Post Office Building

subsection.text: The facility of the United States Postal Service located at 40 Fulton Street in Middletown, New York, shall be known and designated as the Benjamin A. Gilman Post Office Building.

Any reference in a law, map, regulation, document, paper, or other record of the United States to the facility referred to in subsection (a) shall be deemed to be a reference to the Benjamin A. Gilman Post Office Building.

attestation-group.role: Speaker of the House of Representatives.
Vice President of the United States and President of the Senate.
